required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase II Study of PCSK9 Inhibitor AK102 in Patients With Hypercholesterolemia
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-blind, Randomized, Placebo-controlled, Multicenter Phase II Study of AK102 in the Treatment of Hypercholesterolemia Patients at Very High or High Risk of Cardiovascular Disease

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a double-blind, randomized, placebo-controlled, multicenter study to evaluate the safety and efficacy of AK102 in patients with Hypercholesterolemia Patients at Very High or High Risk of Cardiovascular Disease .
The primary objective of this study is to evaluate the efficacy of AK102 in patients with Hypercholesterolemia Patients at Very High or High Risk of Cardiovascular Disease .

primary_outcome.measure: Percent change from baseline in low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) at Week 12

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent change from baseline in low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C)
Percent change from baseline in high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C)
Percent change from baseline in non High-density lipoprotein (non-HDL) cholesterol
Percent change from baseline in serum Triglyceride (TG) cholesterol
Percent change from baseline in Apolipoprotein B (Apo B)
Percent change from baseline in Apolipoprotein A-I (ApoA-I)
Percent change from baseline in Lipoprotein(a) [Lp-(a)]
Percent change from baseline in Total Cholesterol(TC)
Number of subjects who develop detectable anti-drug antibodies (ADAs)
secondary_outcome.description: The immunogenicity of AK102 will be assessed by summarizing the number of subjects who develop detectable anti-drug antibodies.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in proprotein convertase subtilisin/kexin type 9 (PCSK9)

arm_group.description: Participants received AK102 450 mg subcutaneous injection once every 4 weeks (Q4W) for 12 weeks
Participants received AK102 300 mg subcutaneous injection once every 4 weeks (Q4W) for 12 weeks
Participants received AK102 150 mg subcutaneous injection once every 2 weeks (Q2W) for 12 weeks
Participants received AK102 75 mg subcutaneous injection once every 2 weeks (Q2W) for 12 weeks
Participants received placebo subcutaneous injection once every 4 weeks (Q4W) for 12 weeks
Participants received placebo subcutaneous injection once every 2 weeks (Q2W) for 12 weeks

overall_official.affiliation: Zhong Shan Hospital Fu Dan University

facility.name: Zhong Shan Hosipital Fu Dan University
